intro: Hieracium leptolygum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems, often growing in meadows and grasslands. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette at the base. Hieracium leptolygum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain environments.
